t: Job 5
Call*p now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
For*p wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.
I*p have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
His*p children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.
Whose*p harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.
Although*p affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
Yet*p man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
I*p would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:
Which*p doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
Who*p giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:
To*p set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.
He*p disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
He*p taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
They*p meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
But*p he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.
So*p the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
Behold,*p happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
For*p he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.
He*p shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
In*p famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.
Thou*p shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
At*p destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
For*p thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
And*p thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.
Thou*p shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
Thou*p shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.
Lo*p this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
